We start by â€œundoâ€ingâ€ the transforms in the reverse order of their application. The list of transforms applied to the original word was:

â€ƒâ€ƒTransform_7, Transform_4, Transform_1, Transform_3, Transform_5, Transform_4, Transform_4, Transform_8

To recover the original word we must â€œinvertâ€ them in the reverse order. In other words, let the original word be X. The final emoji string is

â€ƒâ€ƒFinal = Transform_8( Transform_4( Transform_4( Transform_5( Transform_3( Transform_1( Transform_4( Transform_7(X) ) ) ) ) ) ) )

1. Inverse of Transform_8 (â€œConvert letters to emojisâ€):

â€ƒâ€ƒGroup 16: ðŸ¢ðŸ“ðŸŽ¯  

â€ƒUsing the mapping table, we decode:
â€ƒâ€ƒâ€¢ ðŸ¢ðŸ“ðŸŽ¯ â†’ Q  
â€ƒâ€ƒâ€¢ ðŸ¦ðŸŽðŸŽ§ â†’ I  
â€ƒâ€ƒâ€¢ ðŸŒ»ðŸðŸŽ² â†’ S

â€ƒSo after inverting Transform_8 we have:
â€ƒâ€ƒX0 = "QIIIISSHHAAMMFFQ"

2. Inverse of the next transform (the last one applied before Transform_8): Transform_4 (â€œReverseâ€). Inverse of a reversal is simply reversing.  
â€ƒLet X1 = reverse(X0).  
â€ƒReversing "QIIIISSHHAAMMFFQ" letterâ€byâ€letter yields:  
â€ƒâ€ƒX1 = "QFFMMAAHHSSIIIIQ"

3. The transform before that was also Transform_4. Reverse again (i.e. reverse X1) to obtain:  
â€ƒâ€ƒX2 = reverse(X1) = "QIIIISSHHAAMMFFQ"  
â€ƒ(This double reversal cancels out, but we follow the steps.)

4. The next earlier transform was Transform_5 (â€œCyclic shift left by twoâ€). Its inverse is a cyclic shift right by two.  
â€ƒTake X2 = "QIIIISSHHAAMMFFQ". To cyclically shift right by 2, take the last 2 letters and put them at the front.  
â€ƒThe last two letters of X2 are â€œFâ€ and â€œQâ€.  
â€ƒThus, X3 = "FQ" + "QIIIISSHHAAMMF" = "FQQIIIISSHHAAMMF"

5. Next, before that was Transform_3 (â€œCyclic shift right by oneâ€). Its inverse is a cyclic shift left by one.  
â€ƒTake X3 = "FQQIIIISSHHAAMMF". Remove the first letter and append it to the end:  
â€ƒâ€ƒThe first letter is "F" and the remainder is "QQIIIISSHHAAMMF".  
â€ƒThen X4 = "QQIIIISSHHAAMMFF"

6. Next, earlier we had Transform_1 (â€œRepeat each letterâ€). Its inverse is to â€œcompressâ€ by taking every two letters (which are identical) and converting them into one letter.  
â€ƒBreak X4 = "QQ IIII SS HH AA MM FF" into pairs:  
â€ƒâ€ƒâ€¢ "QQ" â†’ Q  
â€ƒâ€ƒâ€¢ "II" â†’ I  
â€ƒâ€ƒâ€¢ "II" â†’ I  
â€ƒâ€ƒâ€¢ "SS" â†’ S  
â€ƒâ€ƒâ€¢ "HH" â†’ H  
â€ƒâ€ƒâ€¢ "AA" â†’ A  
â€ƒâ€ƒâ€¢ "MM" â†’ M  
â€ƒâ€ƒâ€¢ "FF" â†’ F  
â€ƒThus, X5 = "QIISHAMF"

7. Next, before that was Transform_4 (a reversal). Its inverse is to reverse again:  
â€ƒX6 = reverse(X5) = reverse("QIISHAMF") = "FMAHSIIQ"

8. Finally, the very first transform applied was Transform_7 (â€œShift letters at odd-indexed positionsâ€ where positions are counted 1-indexed; i.e. positions 1, 3, 5, ... got shifted forward by one).  
â€ƒIts inverse is to subtract one (cyclically) from the letters at positions 1, 3, 5, â€¦ while leaving the others unchanged.  
â€ƒConsider X6 = "F M A H S I I Q" (positions 1 to 8):
â€ƒâ€ƒPosition 1 (odd): F â†’ letter before F is E  
â€ƒâ€ƒPosition 2 (even): M stays M

â€ƒâ€ƒPosition 8 (even): Q stays Q  
â€ƒThus, after this adjustment we get:  
â€ƒâ€ƒX7 = "E M Z H R I H Q", or concatenated: "EMZHRIHQ"

So the original word is: EMZHRIHQ

Answer: EMZHRIHQ
